page.title: 19Port of Sunderland 1.
page.content: The River Wear,the port and shipbuilding are the main reasons for Sunderland's growth to a population of over 300,000.Sunderland was an important shipbuilding centre in the 17th.century and later,in 1834,the town was producing about half of all the ships built in this country.Records show that coal was shipped as early as 1396,but there was a lull and in 1565 Sunderland was described as a 'fishing town'.By 1609 trade had grown to 11,000tonnes of coal exported and by 1710 coal shipments had reached 175,000tonnes.The peak figure was 5 million tonnes per year.Development of the port began in 1717.The North Docks were opened in 1837,the South Docks in 1850 and Corporation Quay in 1934. {CONT on page 20.}
